inn1.comm: nearly a boundary straight, but excellent work on the fine-leg boundary by Woakes. Finn started short of a length, angled into Dilshan who pulls it fine but Woakes scampers around and pulls out a dive
fuller on middle and off, Dilshan shuffles onto the front foot and plays to mid-on
full on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off, Dilshan angles to the face and cuts it backward of point to wide third man
on middle and off, back of a length, defended to the covers
fuller delivery, on middle, just a hint of it straightening on Kusal as he defends to the off side. Decent start by Finn.
gets away with this, his eyes lit up at a short-of-a-length delivery and he came off a fat top edge but just had the legs to loop over the leg-side infield and land safely
good delivery, full at off stump, nips back into Dilshan and takes an inside edge into his pad...a strangled lbw shout
back of a length, tucked into midwicket and he spots the chance to rotate the strike
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
got him! Woakes strikes early. It's a short delivery, not quite as wide as Kusal thought, he's a little cramped for room as he tries to cut and can't keep the ball down as it finds backward point
short of a length on off stump, he defends on the back foot
resumes on a good length, at middle and off, defended towards the on side
this one is shorter, outside off, enough width for Dilshan to deliberately upper-cut it over the gully area and it beats third man
fuller, still played off the back foot, square of the wicket into the off side
a wild stroke this time, chasing a full and fairly delivery, probably fair enough in a shortened game, and it rushes past the outside edge
another air shot, this time across the line, it was a back-of-a-length delivery which he went to pull and it went under the bottom edge
pitches this full on off stump, Dilshan holds his shape on the stroke this time and drives it perfectly between cover and mid-off...a mixed bag of an over for Dilshan, but still worth eight
full outside off, driven back down the pitch
touch more width this time, can free his arms as he drives and the ball runs backward of point to third man
takes advantage of some width, a savage square drive which beats a flying backward point...he certainly hasn't held back since the resumption
full and straight, flicked powerfully straight to mid-on
short ball, and dispatched again...Dilshan saw that so early that he was able to pull it through midwicket rather than square leg. Outfield seams pretty quick
gets back on a full length, punched to mid-off

tight run! Full outside off, pushed softly towards mid-off and Sangakkara raced out of the blocks for the single although still pulled out a dive to get home. Root flicked towards the stumps, but the batsman would have made it
short again, sits up nicely, pulled out to deep square-leg
short and wide to Sangakkara now, and that's put away with ease and a touch more grace than Dilshan...placed with precision between backward point and square cover with a horizontal bat
full at off stump, a well-timed drive straight of mid-off but Root pulls out a full-length dive to his left
edged and gone! It was back of a length again, think Finn rolled his fingers across the seam, Dilshan went for the cut and a comfortable edge went through to Buttler. Crucial blow.
full outside off, a sighter for him, left alone
back of a length on off stump, worked to midwicket
full toss outside off but he gets away with as Woakes gets an out-stretched right hand on the ball as Sangakkara drives
better delivery, nips back off a length into Sangakkara  and takes him high on the back leg
good work by Cook at short cover, that may have saved a boundary as Sangakkara ping a strong cover drive but the England captain leapt to his left and parried it towards mid-off
and another! Inroads for England. Kandamby's return is a brief one. Pushed at a short-of-a-length delivery outside off and just guides the ball at a nice catching height to slip.
goes full, angled into the pads but Mathews' clip goes straight to square leg
pushed across outside off, left alone...Sri Lanka will need to take stock for a little while now
another lovely drive, comes forward and leans into a textbook square drive which goes perfectly through point
drags the length back, on off stump, defended to Finn
defended towards mid-on
slower ball, comes out as a full toss which he can only bunt to mid-on
full outside off, driven into the pitch and it bounces out to Stokes in the covers
short of a length outside off, defended into the covers
back of a length, whipped off his bottom with a lot of bottom hand and he gets it down to long leg
angled down to third man and that takes Sangakkara to 13,000 ODI runs
full outside off, a punchy drive off the front foot finds short cover
flicked away from off stump into square leg
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
flicked from outside off down to long on
round the wicket, worked off the stumps into midwicket
touch shorter, Mathews works it off the back foot but can't beat midwicket
places it past the midwicket this time with a flick of the wrists
angles into the pads, deflected away fine of short fine leg - comes off the pad - but it's chased down
short of a length on the stumps, worked backward of square on the leg side
width offered outside off, Sangakkara drives forcefully through the covers to the sweeper
short of a length outside off, punched nicely off the back foot to deep cover
better delivery, fuller, hint of seam movement which squares up Sangakkara as he aims to the leg side but the leading edge runs safely into the off side
width again outside off, this time Mathews picks out point with his back-foot drive
drop and run, smart cricket. Pushed towards mid-on and he spotted the chance, had to get a hustle on but was home before the direct hit
some slowish turn, Mathews works with it and tucks another single to deep square-leg
round the wicket, full on leg stump, tucked to short fine-leg who is deep enough to allow the single
fuller, nudged down the ground
better line to the left hander, on middle, defended to midwicket
pushed down to long off
flicked through straight midwicket so he'll keep the strike
his eyes lit up at another wide delivery, but this time it beats the edge as he drives on the up
worked off his pads through midwicket
short of a length, on off stump, a better line, dropped into the off side and he wanted a single but point was around quickly
finds a gap this time, just waits a fraction longer, opens the face and guides it backward of point to third man
round the wicket, short of a length, eased through straight midwicket
full and straight, elegantly flicked out to deep square
short of a length, Mathews waits on the back foot and nudges into square leg
full and eased down the ground to long off
worked to midwicket
can't beat square leg as he plays off the back foot to a slightly shorter delivery
gets his foot onto off stump, his head over the line, and flicks to long on
angled down the leg side, Sangakkara misses his sweep, good take by Buttler. First wide of the innings
and that's the second wide, Moeen losing his line and spearing it past the pads
back on off stump, driven to short cover
a bouncer, angled over Mathews back and towards the leg side, it continues to move and Buttler can't take it...called wide
round the wicket, angled into the body, worked to long leg
edged! No slips in. A boundary to third man. Decent pace from Jordan, short of a length outside off, Mathews playing away from his body and that would have been swallowed by a slipper
fuller, on off stump, defended to midwicket
slower ball, Mathews picks it and just holds his stroke before closing the face and getting a single to the leg side
angled in from round the wicket, defended back to the bowler
keeping it short of a length, pushes at it off the back foot and finds point
the straighter delivery, takes a leading edge as Mathews aims to the leg side
appeal for lbw as Mathews goes for the reverse sweep, taken low on the front leg but probably outside the line...pretty close, though
flicked to midwicket
full outside off, driven to long on
flicked through midwicket
as close to ugly as batting gets from Sangakkara, comes down the pitch and shapes to go over the leg side but gets a think inside edge out to deep square leg as he wasn't quite in the ideal position

round the wicket, on the stumps, nudged through the leg side and there's a misfield by Stokes which allows a second...he done the hard part, chasing it down, but then scooped the ball away from himself
wide outside off, left alone, called wide
just stops himself from driving this in the air, bunts to cover rather than following through with the shot
cut out to the cover sweeper
full outside off, driven to the deep sweeper
picks out cover as he drives
a loopy slower delivery, full at the toes, flicked to deep square and that brings up a well-compiled fifty stand
full outside, opens the face to guide it through point. Another example of simple, controlled placement in one-day cricket
the bowler compensates by going straight and Sangakkara responds with a sweep which is very well struck and doesn't give deep square a chance
back outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
worked off the pads down to long leg
pushed in towards leg stump, closes the face to place it to deep square...toying with the field
pushed down the leg side, Mathews steps inside the line to ensure he gets the wide
full and straight, helped down to long on
full on off stump, taking the pace off the ball, pushed back to Bopara
angled into the pads but doesn't cost anything as Mathews finds short fine leg and is angry with himself
opens the face as he drives to place it wide of cover
dragged down shorter, Sangakkara pulls through midwicket, all along the ground, and long on comes around
width outside off and superbly placed, cut very firmly through backward point and deep cover can't get around...lovely from the captain, loose from Bopara
another slower ball, full outside off, rolls his wrists to send it out to deep midwicket
full at the off stump, poked at and gets a thick edge down to third man
full to the left-hander's off stump now, pressed up to mid-off and they take a sharp single to bring the hundred up
length ball touched from around middle and off through square leg
length again, angled in from around the wicket, this is pressed to backward point
slower ball, picked up and swung down the ground, pretty good timing and almost gets it all the way back over the long-oon rope, bounces just short
short now, Sangakkara sways inside the line
leg side wide, not a great start
full on the stumps, nudged out to deep square leg
tries to advance, mistimes an attempted swat of a back of a length ball down the ground, it bounces over Stokes but not mid-off
stays in the crease here to work this to long leg
full, drifting down leg, helped on it's way to the fine leg fence
touch shorter and straighter, flicked out to deep backward square
fullish length, Sangakkara tries to go down the ground again, didn't seem to get all of it but enough of it over mid-on and skipping to the boundary

a step down the track, swing at a length ball outside off and nicks it to the keeper! Wild stroke and Mathews falls just when England needed a wicket. A very poor choice, so unnecessary because the partnership was moving along very nicely. Got in a poor position, took a big swing, almost swung himself off his feet, and got a feather edge to Buttler
length at the off stump, guided into the gully
back of a length, tucked through square leg for an easy couple between two deep fielders
fuller length, nudged back to the bowler
touch shorter, turned down to long leg
around the wicket, nudged from middle and off into the leg side, no run available in the region of midwicket
back foot push to cover, diving left-hand save from Eoin Morgan
stays back and defends this in front of middle stump
down the wicket and heaved over mid-on, meaty strike, not all timed but enough club, almost six
back and now nudged down to the long-on who's just gone back
full length, confident press down to long-off, fifty for Sangakkara
touch more air, pressed to the right hand of the bowler where Moeen scrambles across to make the save
length wide of off stump, cracked to the off side sweeper
good length just outside off stump, driven firmly to midwicket off the inner half of the bat
short and pulled wide of deep square for an easy couple
waits for this to come across him and carves down to third man
slower ball on the stumps, pressed only to mid-on
full outside off, driven firmly but only as far as extra cover
back and playing from off stump to point
a step down working this from outside off to midwicket
down again, steers this wide of deep cover for a couple
another advance, nudged just back up to the bowler's left hand
tossed up on off stump, driven to extra cover
forward press towards point
gives himself room off side to cut, gets it to cover point who has to dive so they can take a single
fuller just outside off, driven without timing to extra cover
angled in, a swing to leg misses, it runs off the pad behind point for a leg bye
full at the off stump, slapped to mid-off who is right on the edge of the 30-yard circle so they take a run
straighter line and this is nicely picked up over the leg side, a fluent stroke and decent timing wide and over mid-on
short and angled only to short third man
full at the stumps, Sangakkara clears the front leg and mows this over the leg side, no-one out at wide long-on, solid thump
gives himself room to leg, Jordan banged it in and Sangakkara waited for it and guided it superbly over short third man
full and swung leg side once again, there's now a man back at deep midwicket but this is wide of him, Stokes chases to his right and does well with a slide to save four, 150 up

slower ball, goes to swing leg side again but this is mistimed and picks out mid-on! Another importantly-timed wicket for England just when the hosts were going well. Sangakkara cleared the front leg away again but got this high on the bat and it was a simple chance for Moeen Ali at waist height, hardly had to move. Well bowled from Jordan, back over the wicket and ran his fingers across it
back of a length, tucked down to long leg
fuller length but also worked down to long leg for a single
full at the off stump, nicely guided with an open face to short third man who's slide to his right can't totally make the save and it runs out to the boundary
length on the stumps, worked out through square leg
slower ball just outside off, forced off the back foot but misjudged and it's in the air but fortunately for the batsman between extra-cover and the squarer fielder
waited for and guided down to third man who's now back on the fence
back of a length, tucked wide of short long leg for an easy run
back of a length at the body, tucked down to long leg
full at the off stump, turned through square leg and the deep fielder does really well to save the second
full at the stumps, driven down to long-on
slower ball, guided from a full length to short third man, they run to the fielder
full at the stumps, worked out through midwicket and it's just another single
this slips down the leg side
length ball just outside off, pressed to mid-off who can't prevent the single that deep
slower ball, full, struck well down the ground, Moeen to his right slides and makes a decent save
forward and tucked off the stumps wide of midwicket for an easy single
back punching this down to long-on
goes for the reverse sweep from leg stump and gets plenty of it over point, well struck
slides down the leg side

tries to line up a slog sweep to leg but mistimes it and Finn takes a smart catch moving across to his left at square leg. Mendis sweeping conventionally this time from outside off, didn't get hold of it at all and it rather looped to Finn's right, he moved quickly across to take a tumbling chance
pressed from just outside off to the right hand of the bowler
driven again, this just to extra cover
length on the stumps, worked out through midwicket for an easy run
back of a length sliding across the left-hander who tried to guide it towards the off side but played and missed
bumper, ducked beneath
slower, full ball, flicked into the leg side, well short of deep midwicket running in
touch more leg side this line so flicked wide of deep square and they get a couple
back of a length, calmly pulled out to deep square
slower ball well outside off, would have been a wide if left but Thirimanne reached for it and got a toe through cover
full ball, blasted down the ground but Cook saves smartly going to his right
slower again but wide again and this time cut over backward point, poor ball
a little short again and a touch of width too, cut hard and flashed past a diving short third man
third man now back but Stokes bowls much fuller and gets driven past mid-off, lovely stroke, perfectly timed
fuller still, tapped down the ground to long-on, should have been just a single but Hales misfielded and they came back for the second
full but too wide of the off stump is it, maybe not
back on the stumps, pulled without timing to midwicket
slower ball, seen and smashed over wide long-on, nailed it, almost out of this enormous playing field - the biggest in the world

swing again into the leg side, this time not timed at all, gets it high and Moeen takes the catch retreating from mid-on. Needed a little juggle but he held on. Perera fancied some leg side rope again but was off balance trying to swing away this shorter ball, got it high on the bat and Moeen did the rest, just about
goes around the wicket, full on the leg stump and this is clipped past short long leg, poor ball with that field, fifty for Thirimanne in 39 balls
cutter, yorker length, jammed into midwicket and they take a run
full on the stumps, tucked wide of midwicket and they get a little single
length at the stumps, deceived the batsman in the flight a little, he misses with a push to leg, brief appeal for lbw but was going down

swing to leg misses, it comes off the pad towards square leg, they take a leg bye, Buttler is at it in a flash and tries to throw down the bowler's end stumps, Prasad is just home but it was lazy running
pressed wide enough of extra-cover for an easy single
mighty heave to leg and clears the midwicket rope, clears the front leg and swing hard and to good effect
another leg side bash and it's long enough again, over long-on this time, agricultural once more but effective enough
full on the stumps, tucked down to long-on
full ball just outside off, an attempted off drive gets a thick toe of the bat and flashes past Buttler for four, very fortunate for the batsman
slower ball, goes down the ground but off a thick outside edge, it squirts to short third man
full, nudged into the leg side and they charge for two but Stokes is in very quickly to make the save
lifted down the ground, inside long-on, another nice strike from Prasad

slower ball, another mighty swing to leg is attempted but he misses and is stumped. Bopara totally deceiving the batsman who swung himself off his feet almost, got nowhere near it and Buttler had a very simple job to tick off the bails
full on the stumps, a delicious straight drive with the full face of the bat and it beats Hales sliding across at long-on, lovely clean strike
yorker, jammed out to short third man who saves well diving to his right
well down leg, a good two feet
back of a length, pulled without much timing to deep midwicket
full just outside off, swung hard into the off side, deep cover is quickly to his left to save the second
length ball skids by an attempted slap towards somewhere, don't quite know what Herath had planned there
slower ball, pulled into the leg side, back goes Bopara at midwicket but he can't quite take the chance running back, saves two though

inn2.comm: full on leg stump, tucked to midwicket
full outside off, going across the left hander, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
that's a beauty! Beats Cook all ends up. A full delivery, starting on middle and off, moves off the seam and beats the lunging outside edge
works a straight delivery to mid-on
gets off the mark, for himself and the innings, with a dab down to third man
hint of width outside off, short, cut straight to cover
picks out the off-side ring again
dragged down a little short, Cook is on the back foot and pulls to deep midwicket
angled into the pads, neatly clipped away through square, decent piece of timing
slightly short, Moeen on the back foot and punches to cover
comes down the pitch, it's a straight delivery, he heaves it through midwicket, in the air but it's vacant inside the circle, but it's just a single
back of a length on middle and leg, flicked to the left of mid-on
flicks this off his pads through midwicket, he comes back for a second but isn't moving freely
that's a cracking shot, strides forward into a full delivery and drives perfectly wide of mid-off...nothing wrong with that, at all
back of a length, dabbed towards the slips
another terrific drive, mid-off had moved a touch wider so Cook drives straighter this time and goes to the left of the fielder
full outside off, left alone
big appeal for lbw as Moeen goes down the sweep and gets taken on the front pad, but it did seem to be angling down the leg side
that's lovely from Moeen, goes up and over the off side with a controlled lofted drive which goes one bounce over the rope
this one is dragged down shorter, Moeen rocks onto the back foot and drives wide of long off
down the pitch again, loses his shape a little this time and it turns into a bit of a hack through the leg side to deep square
full at off stump, comes forward and plays it back to the bowler
drives into the covers, can't pierce the off-side field but manages a single to keep the strike
back of a length on middle, neatly timed in front of square on the leg side for a brace
full on off stump, it's pinging off the middle okay at the moment although this one finds mid-off
keeping it full, Cook gets across onto off stump and jabs down on the ball
another good drive, firmly to mid-off, but he's deep enough to allow a sharp single

all the way! And not sure it was entirely middled, either. It was full outside off, he turned his wrists and lofted it clean over the covers...clears the boundary by a few meters. Beautiful stroke. Conviction.
goes for a pull this time, Perera drops short of a length, but the is defeat by the angle outside off stump
short outside leg stump, must have clipped the pad because it's not given a wide
pushed across wide outside off, Cook catches up with it with a late cut which whistles to third-man boundary. Using Mendis' pace to his advantage
down the leg side again, this doesn't touch anything
flicked off the pads to deep square leg
staying on the legs, flicked behind square
too leg side from Mendis, being milked off the pads by both batsmen
full outside leg, he goes for a sweep but misses and the ball takes the pad to short fine leg. Moeen feels he missed out
full on off stump, defended
slightly shorter, slides into Cook who plays it off the back foot
gets this fine, probably finer than he wanted, as he late cuts this just wide of slip and the outfield does the rest of the work
strides forward and nudges to midwicket
driven into the off side
quicker ball on off stump, he can only pat it to mid-on
over the wicket, played into the leg side
paddles this from outside off, a full delivery, through short fine leg
this is out of the screws! Moeen showing his confidence. Mendis bowling this slightly wider outside off, but Moeen picked it up with a strong slog-sweep which clears deep midwicket
dragged down short, pulled to deep backward square
presses forward, not easily, takes an inside edge into the leg side
pushed square into the off sidde
pulled out to deep square leg although it wasn't that short, Cook could have been in bother
there's a googly, Moeen drives off the back foot to long off
full outside leg, gets over the top of a sweep and there's a poor piece of fielding by deep square running around the boundary
short outside off, cut into the off side. Cook hobbles away from the shot
punched off the back foot to the off side, Mendis gets across and fields
beats the outside edge with one that slides across Cook's flat-footed prod
full on the stumps, flicked out to deep midwicket
big stride in, forward press out to deep cover
down the wicket and whacked leg side and over the rope, dragged not off the meat but enough mash to get it to travel
and another! This over extra cover, down the wicket and gracefully lifting this over the off side, superb shot
touch dragged down, punched out to deep cover
solid forward defence from Cook
full on the leg stump, nudged back up the wicket
swept this time off leg stump, in the air but landing well short of deep backward square
forward press outside off to extra cover
back on the stumps, nudged through square leg for an easy single
goes back and a wristy flick gets an edge fine of short third man, just a single
swept off leg stump, gets it just to short long leg
back of a length just outside off, pulled hard straight back down the ground inside mid-on, surely not where he was aiming but got more than enough bat on it
short, Moeen tried to guide it behind square on the off side and missed, too tight for the delivery
not quite as short, this is pulled out to deep midwicket

full length angled across Cook who pushes at it and edges behind! Prasad with the breakthrough. A ball Cook should have left, it was a nothing stroke, played away from his body, and Cook's promising start comes to an end
bumper first ball, ducked, Sangakkara can't take it going to his left but they refuse the bye
length a foot outside off stump, guided down to third man and oh dear! Herath lets it go straight through his hands, very poor fielding and spoils a top over
floated up just outside off, gracefully nudged out through the cover and that's Moeen's fifty, another exciting innings, 29-balls
driven firmly from outside off stump to deep cover
pushed at quite firmly but it was well in front of cover
slower delivery, Moeen well forward just blocking this
down the wicket and another delicious strike down the ground over long-on, fabulous timing

plays forward, beaten on the inside edge, appeal for lbw but there was too much doubt and it runs inside short third man for a leg bye. Sri Lanka go for the review this seems optimistic. Did it pitch outside leg? Yes it did, so end of conversation. There was also a thick inside edge so that's an awful review on the whole! A lot of time is being wasted looking at the replay of the inside edge, it's clear as day, but before that it pitched outside leg. Finally not out confirmed and Sri Lanka lose the review
full just outside off, a flashing drive reaches deep cover
length just outside off, Hales with a strong stride forward and presses out to deep cover
full again, tried to be swung down the ground, mistimed but a single inside mid-off is taken
bumper that drifts down leg
length ball, nudged towards mid-on, Hales takes on the fielder and gets home comfortably enough in the end

bumper, Moeen hooks at it, Sangakkara takes the catch and there's a raucous appeal for caught behind, not out given and Sri Lanka have burned their review. But a great decision cause it seems to have come off Moeen's shoulder
another appeal, this time for lbw but it's pitched way outside leg stump and runs into the covers
firm drive from off stump to mid-off
length delivery on the stumps, tucked out to deep square
a rather lazy drive at a length ball a foot and a half outside off, beaten on the inside edge
tighter line, knocked up the wicket, Hales slipped turning back into his ground and there was almost a run out chance

opens the face and presses wide enough of mid-off for a single but oh no!! Hales is rooted to the crease at the non-striker's end, Moeen has to get back but the throw is in time! What a complete disaster for England. There was a single available all day but for some reason Hales shuffled out of his ground a few yards but without turning to face his partner, shuffled back to the bowler's end, Moeen has almost run two and is short getting back to the striker's end
forward just outside off pressing to point
leg side wide
tight off stump line, Hales forward pressing up to mid-off
full delivery, is that a hint of inswing? Pressed through cover for a single
full delivery just wide of off stump, Root drives at it, late to come forward to it, and plays and misses
beaten again, similar ball, Root a little unsure with his footwork and plays and misses once more
this angles back and strikes Root too high on the pad for an lbw shout, Prasad fired up here though
this angles back a little but Root is onto his stumps tucking into the leg side and they run hard for two
good length on off stump, Hales out to play a forward defence
short and pulled very hard, superb fielding at deep square leg, diving across to his right and making a fine save
back of a length and pulled rather more gently to the deep square
waited for an punched with excellent timing wide of third man, great stroke, touch wide from the bowler
short down the leg side, another cry for caught behind, no appeal from the wicketkeeper this time, called wide
some more width outside off but this is pushed only to point off the front foot
back of a length and pulled again, this straight to the deep square
on a length at off stump, flicked firmly to midwicket
angled into the pads, flicked to long leg
short at leg stump, he stays inside the line and pull to long leg
drives on the up through the covers to the sweeper
neatly played, hangs on the back foot, it's a reasonable wide delivery, he opens the face down to third man
full outside off, loses his timing as he drives to cover
pushed in at leg stump from round the wicket, pushed firmly through midwicket
delivered from wide on the crease, speared down the leg side
plays with a straight bat through midwicket and they turn it into a very quick two...foot to the floor, Hales' big strides helping on this occasion
driven to midwicket
pushing it into leg stump again, Root on the back foot and clips to deep square leg
into the leg side
full on the pads, clipped behind square on the leg side. Not a great line from Herath in that over.
driven off the back foot to the cover sweeper...no need for anything silly at the moment
full on the stumps, punched to mid-on
full and straight, turns his wrists and picks out deep square
tries to find space in the off side but just finds cover
gets too straight this time, as easy clip off the toes but it's just a single to deep midwicket
full at off stump, pushed firmly back to Mathews. Good over by the captain to nudge the asking rate up.
useful boundary as Herath is still to straight, it drifts towards leg stump and Root glances it nicely fine past the keeper
better line, full on middle and off, driven back to the bowler
a stutter in the running, but all is okay in the end. Root nudged off his toes, it was a long single but for some reason they both hesitated mid-pitch
pushed back down the pitch
uses his feet, goes for a drive and gets a think inside edge into his boot
nicely bowled, much slower, held back, Hales is reaching out for the ball and gets another inside edge which rolls off his pad to the off side

dropped, my goodness! What a miss. A short-of-a-length delivery was forced off the back foot by Hales and went at thigh-height to Thirimanne at midwicket who shelled a sitter. Just slipped out of his hands
worked behind square on the leg side
angled into leg stump, helped down to long leg
that's big enough! Cashes in on a short ball - saw of few of these in his T20 hundred - as he swivels on a pull/hook which carries comfortably over long leg

gone this time! Hales can't make the most of his life, he was itching to cut loose. Used his feet, it was a length delivery, and he heaved it to mid-on who just had to move a little to his left. Didn't really need to do that after the earlier reprieve and the six
full on off stump, cautiously nudged to midwicket
this slides on with the arm, Root plays off the back foot into the covers which is a little dangerous
no hanging around from R Bop, he takes a could of steps down the pitch and lofts this straight down the ground. Cracking strike.

brilliant from Sangakkara! Wonderful anticipation. He saw Bopara go down early for a paddle sweep and started to move to his left, and when the ball glanced off the face of the bat he snaffled the catch brilliantly almost by the edge of the cut strip.
full on the stumps, worked to midwicket
full and dug out back to the bowler
worked off the pads wide of midwicket and after a bit of shouting it's an easy single

the collapse is on! Morgan's problems continue. It was a short ball, not especially rapid but well directed around middle and leg, he went for the hook and the ball took a top edge with was comfortably held at long leg
on off stump, defended back towards Mathews
full outside off, opens the face and just beats a diving Dilshan at backward point
driven through the covers to sweeper
back of a length, played into the off side
beaten! Root driving at a back-of-a-length delivery. There's a half-hearted appeal
full at the stumps, pushed down to long on
nudged off the pads into midwicket
drifts outside leg stump but only costs a single as it's clipped to short fine leg
goes to turn this to the on side, plays a fraction earlier and it goes straight
pushed into the off side
defended into the leg side
on the hip, flicked to deep square leg
dropped in short, Buttler rolls his wrists as he pulls to deep square leg
full at off stump, tries to work it with his wrists to the leg side but can only find midwicket
flicks this wide of the man inside the circle on the leg side
worked out to deep square
pushed into the off side
nearly done in the flight but just holds back in his shot so is able to chip it short of long off
drives off the back foot to short cover
close! Again playing off the back foot. He basically cut this off the stumps. You've got to get your hand-eye coordination right there. Chops to short third man
driven and can't beat cover
he shows some of his power through the off side, slaps this through cover when he's offered a hint of width
full, almost a yorker, drilled back to the bowler
short and wheeled behind square leg, poor ball well put away, first boundary for 29 balls
fuller length and clipped through midwicket
length at the body, dabbed down towards point but there's no taking on Dilshan in there
goes for the scoop but missed completely, it goes over middle stump, that was right in the slot for that shot
defended from off stump in Dilshan's range again but nothing going in there
length on the stumps and another dot pushed back to the bowler
pushed from the stumps out to deep square
down the track, worked wide of deep midwicket for an easy couple
down again, held back from the bowler, Buttler clips it wide of short long leg for a sharp single
waited for an cut straight to backward point but there's a misfield so they get a run
Buttler advances, Mendis tried to toss it up but got it all wrong and it ended up a full toss way down leg, Buttler threw the bat at it and smashes it to the backward square fence
full on the middle and leg stumps, tucked back up the wicket
back foot press to point
slightly short, Root tries to heave it to the leg side but Kandamby gets down very well to his left and saves four
full just outside off, swing and a miss from Buttler aiming down the ground
gets this one away though, full once more and wide enough to swing through, smashes it over extra cover and it raced away
angled in at the stumps, Buttler just pushes to mid-on
full at the off stump, driven straight to extra cover
back trying to play to leg, struck on the pad
down the wicket, bowler drops his length, Buttler can only tap it back up the wicket
outside off and cut past backward point, loose delivery and Buttler gets a badly-needed boundary
touch short, Buttler right back in his crease, pulled hard and gets it to the square fence
full on leg stump, dropped into the leg side, they sprint hard for two before long-on can get in
outside off, cut hard again but this time Buttler can't pierce the field
step across the stumps and scooped, nailed it for six over long leg, superb stroke, helped all the way, taken off a very full length on middle stump

full again, tries to smash it off side but miscued and caught at extra-cover! It was very full, Root tried to give himself room to swing it away but squirted it straight to the fielder. They check the no-ball and Prasad has overstepped! What an error. A reprieve for Root, an extra for England and a free hit too, what a let off for Root
free hit...heaved off side but again Root doesn't really connect with it and it loops out over cover for just a single
full toss wide of off stump, Buttler cracks it for four past backward point, poor ball and Buttler puts it away
length ball, heaved down the ground and...just over the head of mid-off. It was far from a clean hit but enough club to chip it over mid-off diving back and it skips away to the fence
full length on the stumps, squirted out backward of square, it evades backward point and runs away from third man, four more!
full on the stumps again, calmly pushed down to long-on
goes to reverse sweep and misses it outside off
down the wicket, squirts this away through midwicket and they can run hard for the second
down the wicket, turns it into a full toss and guided through extra-cover, the timing is superb and it's wide of long-off
and again, another full toss and whacked wide of long-off, fifty for Buttler, bringing his side home
a shimmy down once more, smashed down to long-off on the bounce, flat and hard that went
full on the stumps, calmly batted back to the bowler
set up for the paddle sweep then changed his mind and dabbed a ball just outside off to short third man
floated up outside off, driven at and missed
down the wicket and a lovely clean straight strike clears the boundary
back and punching down the ground and that'll do it!
